alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 28 at 3:12PM ChST until January 01 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...East facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Increasing easterly trade-wind swell will cause surf to build to at least 9 feet beginning around Friday night. These surf heights will result in a high risk of dangerous rip currents.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
